moves.1. e4 c5 2. d4:
White to play.

This is the beginning of the Smith-Morra Gambit.
moves.2... cxd4 3. c3 d5: Black isn't interested in the gambit.
moves.4. Qxd4: Bringing the Queen out early violates opening principles.
moves.4... Nf6:
Stockfish prefers 4... dxe4.

Now if 5. exd5 Qxd5.
moves.5... Nc6 6. Bb5 Nd7:
Black is trying to entice the vulnerable Queen forward.

Technically better is 6... Ng8.
moves.7. Qxd5 e6 8. Qe4 Nc5:
Black is playing actively.

Maybe better is 8... Qb6.
moves.11... Bb5: The key move, which controls squares around the White king.
moves.12. Ne2: White can do better with 12. Nd2.
moves.12... Nd3+:
If 13. Kd2 Nxe5+.
If 13. Kd1 Nxb2+ 14. Kc2 Ba4+ 15. Kxb2 Qb6#.

White resigns.  Suppose play were to continue ...
moves.13... Nxc1:
If 14. Nd2 Bxe2+.
If 14. Qh3 Qd1#.

gameName: Casual Blitz Game, Coffee Club Chess Club
